text: Jamiu Abiodun Alimi (born 5 October 1992) is a Nigerian international footballer who plays for Sunshine Stars, as a central defender. ==Career== Born in Lagos, Alimi has played for Tavriya Simferopol, Olympiakos Nicosia, Sharks, Shooting Stars, Kano Pillars and Akwa United. He made his international debut for Nigeria in 2015. Jamiu joined Akwa United on a two- year deal from Kano Pillars, during the 2017–18 mid-season transfer window. On 27 February 2019, he was loaned out to El-Kanemi for the rest of the season because of lack of playing time after falling out of favour with Akwa United manager Rafael Everton.Akwa United’s Jamiu Alimi completes loan move to El Kanemi, brila.net, 27 February 2019 In September 2019 it was confirmed, that he had joined Sunshine Stars.2019 Ogunjobi Gold Cup: Jamiu Alimi heroics put Sunshine Stars into consecutive finals, sportlens360.com, 5 September 2019 ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Lagos Category:Nigerian footballers Category:Nigeria international footballers Category:SC Tavriya Simferopol players Category:Olympiakos Nicosia players Category:Sharks F.C. players Category:Shooting Stars S.C. players Category:Kano Pillars F.C. players Category:Akwa United F.C. players Category:El-Kanemi Warriors F.C. players Category:Sunshine Stars F.C. players Category:Ukrainian Premier League players Category:Cypriot First Division players Category:Nigerian Professional Football League players Category:Association football defenders Category:Nigerian expatriate footballers Category:Nigerian expatriate sportspeople in Ukraine Category:Expatriate footballers in Ukraine Category:Nigerian expatriate sportspeople in Cyprus Category:Expatriate footballers in Cyprus
title: Jamiu Alimi
